channel.title: Dialogue using same cases
channel.description: So atm [CODE] case 23: sendOption3("44 Portals", "East Dragons", "Mage Bank"); c.dialogueAction = 13; break; case 24: sendOption3("Kbd", "Kalphite Queen", "Gwd"); c.dialogueAction = 14; break;[/CODE] Use the same cases in game so that when I use the 44 portals teleport in the dialogue I teleport to kbd because they use the same action button in game so I can make the different dialogues teleport me to different places without this error.[CODE] src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:445: duplicate case label case 9167: ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:451: duplicate case label case 9168: ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:457: duplicate case label case 9169: ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/CODE]How would I fix this?

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @teufel teufel
item.description:
@teufel wrote:

[quote=“Ashton51, post:7, topic:370760”]You have to have it all under one case,

you cant have duplicate cases in a switch statement[/quote]
Thanks bro

Read full topic

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

You have to have it all under one case,

you cant have duplicate cases in a switch statement

Read full topic

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

You’re using duplicate cases, 9167, 9167. You can only use it once.

Read full topic

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @teufel teufel
item.description:
@teufel wrote:

I know how to fix the error but if I select 44 portals I get actionbutton - 9167

And kbd gives me actionbutton - 9167 so how do I mak it so each one teleports me to a different place

Read full topic

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

teufel:

What Im asking is why does both dialogues say that action button?

Obviously because someone made the case twice on accident

just remove one of the cases in the switch statement for each of those

Read full topic

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

I dont see what exactly you are asking?

Duplicate case label means you’ve already declared that case in the switch statement before

Read full topic

item.title: Dialogue using same cases
item.dc:creator: @teufel teufel
item.description:
@teufel wrote:

So atm case 23: sendOption3("44 Portals", "East Dragons", "Mage Bank"); c.dialogueAction = 13; break; case 24: sendOption3("Kbd", "Kalphite Queen", "Gwd"); c.dialogueAction = 14; break;
Use the same cases in game so that when I use the 44 portals teleport in the dialogue I teleport to kbd because they use the same action button in game so I can make the different dialogues teleport me to different places without this error. src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:445: duplicate case label case 9167: ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:451: duplicate case label case 9168: ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:457: duplicate case label case 9169: ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .How would I fix this?
